title: (x) Altoids tin - hand lettered, Goudy Oldstyle {Metadox}
content:
I was wondering what are the fonts used on the Altoids tin ( [http://www.blinman.com/altoids.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130111093436/http:/www.blinman.com/altoids.jpg))   
   
Could anyone help out?   
   
[]'s   
Gabriel
author: anonymous

comments.content:
I kind of like the description:   
" **Curiously** Strong Peppermints"

the [mints](http://web.archive.org/web/20130111093436/https:/www.veer.com/download/wallpaper/breathmint800x600.jpg) are pretty good too...   
   
(sorry, couldn't help myself)

The CURIOUSLY STRONG PEPPERMINTS bit can be   
emulated with [Cyrus Highsmith](http://web.archive.org/web/20130111093436/http:/fontbureau.com/people/person.tpl?cart=10911736612462642&designer=Cyrus%20Highsmith)'s [Dispatch Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20130111093436/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/dispatch/bold/testdrive.html?s=CURIOUSLY%20STRONG%20PEPPERMINTS&p=24).   
   
Man, I like his faces.

Curiously Strong...   
That's what attracted me to this packaging   
   
   
Thanks everyone, i'll take a look into these fonts.

Well, "NET WT. 1.76 OZ" is [Goudy Oldstyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20130111093436/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/goudy/old-style/testdrive.html?s=NET%2BWT.%2B1.76%2BOZ&p=48), but beyond that, I think most of the package is hand-lettered -- "ALTOIDS" is almost certainly custom lettering.   
   
"CURIOUSLY STRONG PEPPERMINTS" is definitely hand-lettered (three different P's, two different S's, probably more inconsistencies than that), but Letterhead's [LHF Full Block](http://web.archive.org/web/20130111093436/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/downloads/index.shtml) is a similar style, and it's free!   
   
"The Original Celebrated" is also probably hand-lettered -- the face that this reminds me the most of is [Windsor](http://web.archive.org/web/20130111093436/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/windsor/)... if you tweaked one of the weights of Windsor and added some strokes, you could probably get very close.   
   
"MADE IN BRITAIN", of course, is Helvetica Medium, maybe Bold. =)
